intro: Cnidium kraussianum, commonly known as the African hogweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, hollow stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks. Due to its toxic sap, it is considered a potential weed in some regions.
